newsitem.title: USA: Study calls for degulated electricity transmission.
newsitem.headline: Study calls for degulated electricity transmission.

text.p: Moves to break up U.S. electric utility monopolies should include the deregulation of transmission rates, a research group said Monday, going beyond existing proposals to open local power markets to competition.

In its proposal, "Creating Competitive Markets in Electric Energy," the Progress and Freedom Foundation also called for the federal government to sell off its power assets and stop subsidizing public power.
Transmission has always been regulated as a natural monopoly. To promote power competition, regulators have simply made utilities give all power producers access to their wires.
